frame.name: Text_creation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Author</fen> creates a <fen>Text</fen>, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech, that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular <fen>Addressee</fen> in mind. The <fen>Text</fen> may include information about its topic, although the latter is not an FE in this frame.
<ex><fex name="Author">I</fex> <t>penned</t> <fex name="Text">a letter concerning racism</fex> <fex name="Addressee">to Congress</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Author">The brothers</fex> <t>said</t> <fex name="Text">not two words</fex> <fex name="Addressee">to each other</fex>.</ex> <ex><t>Jot</t> <fex name="Text">any notes you need</fex> <fex name="Place">below the line</fex> <fex name="Manner">in red pen only</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Components
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Components</fen> are the parts that the <fen>Author</fen> uses to construct the <fen>Text</fen>. <ex> Caitlin <t>wrote</t> the book <fex name="Components">from memoirs she collected</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Text
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking. <ex>Michael <t>wrote</t> <fex name="Text">a frame description</fex>.</ex> <ex> Cybil wanted to <t>speak</t> <fex name="Text">those three words</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action <ex>I <t>wrote</t> everything in that decade <fex name="Depict">on drugs</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The instrument with which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Manner of performing an action. This frame includes some peculiar examples of manner phrases. <t>Write</t> it <fex name="Manner">in pen</fex>. <t>Write</t> it <fex name="Manner">in ink</fex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which a <fen>Text</fen> is created.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the text is created.</def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the person to whom the Message is communicated. When this FE is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by to, or as the direct object, or as the first object in a double object construction.
</def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Beneficiary</fen> identifies the person in whose honor or for whose benefit the <fen>Text</fen> is created.</def-root>

FE.name: Form
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes the form in which the text is presented.
<ex><fex name="Author">Yeats</fex> <t>wrote</t> <t>out</t> his poems <fex name="Form">in prose</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for creating the text. <ex>I <t>wrote</t> the article <fex name="exp">because I would have lost my teaching post otherwise</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>The language in which the <fen>Text</fen> is represented or the physical materials upon which the <fen>Text</fen> is recorded.
<ex>I <t>wrote</t> the code <fex name="Medium">on the back of the envelope</fex>.</ex></def-root>
